I've spent a little time with the current CVS snapshot of Heritrix, and 
a couple of little things got in the way of being able to try it out.  
 From looking at the list archives and other docs, it looks like you 
guys are heading quickly towards a release, and it also looks like CVS 
might not be kept up with your latest work, so I have to assume you know 
about most of this stuff, but the sorts of things that got in the way were:

- build.properties: commons httpclient jar name changed to cvs snapshot 
version
- build.xml: needs to copy oversrc files in compile-core target, when it 
copies src
- parameter "-no-wui" changed to "--no-wui", but startcrawl.sh needs to 
reflect this
- sample order.xml files reflect obsolete schema relative to code

The last was, for me, enough to get me to hold off on any more testing 
for a little while; it'd be straightforward enough to create an 
order.xml from the XPath in the code, but that probably misses the point 
- the code base is in flux right now, and it sounds like I should wait 
for it to settle down.

Is that all a fair assessment?  Is this a bad time to try the codebase 
out, or, with a current example of the order.xml file, should I be able 
to run a crawl from the CVS code? 

I'm looking forward to trying it out...
Andy Boyko    andy@...
